body.p: Indiana-born attorney, businessman, land investor, and soldier. Educated at Bloomington College in Bloomington, Indiana. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1939. Practiced law in Fort Madison, Iowa from 1839 to 1849. Served as a prosecutor in a five county area in Southeast Iowa from 1840 to 1842. Served as president of the Des Moines Valley Railroad Company from 1849 to 1853. Commissioned and served as colonel of the 15th Iowa Infantry Regiment Starting on February 22, 1862. Promoted to brigadier general on April 9, 1863 and commanded a brigade of the XVII Corps in Louisiana—comprised of black and white soldiers. Commanded the District of Cairo from October 1863 to March 16, 1864. Relieved from command and resigned from the army on April 4, 1864. Returned to Des Moines, Iowa and resumed his work with the Des Moines Valley Railroad Company.
